Translation: This gift is for you.
Explanation: 'Para' is used to indicate the recipient of something.

Translation: Thanks for your help.
Explanation: 'Por' is used to express gratitude or cause.

Translation: I am going to the beach.
I am at home.
I left the office.
Explanation: 'De' is used to show origin or separation.

Translation: He/She arrived with his/her friend.
I work to earn money.
Explanation: 'Para' is used to express purpose or goal.

Translation: We walked through the park.

Text: El libro fue escrito {{c1::por}} Gabriel García Márquez.
Translation: The book was written by Gabriel García Márquez.
Explanation: 'Por' shows the agent in passive voice.

Translation: I’ve been studying Spanish since eight o'clock.
Explanation: 'Desde' indicates the starting point in time.

Text: El gato está {{c1::debajo de}} la mesa.
Translation: The cat is under the table.
There is a book between the notebooks.

Text: La tienda está {{c1::al lado de}} la farmacia.
Translation: The store is next to the pharmacy.
Explanation: 'Al lado de' shows proximity or next to.

Text: El cuaderno está {{c1::encima de}} la silla.
Translation: The notebook is on top of the chair.
Explanation: 'Encima de' shows location above or on top.

Text: Las llaves están {{c1::dentro de}} la bolsa.
Translation: The keys are inside the bag.

Text: El coche está {{c1::enfrente de}} la casa.
Translation: The car is in front of the house.
Explanation: 'Enfrente de' shows something is directly in front of.

Text: El baño está {{c1::a la derecha de}} la cocina.
Translation: The bathroom is to the right of the kitchen.
Explanation: 'A la derecha de' indicates right side.

Text: El comedor está {{c1::a la izquierda de}} la sala.
Translation: The dining room is to the left of the living room.
Explanation: 'A la izquierda de' indicates left side.

Text: El perro duerme {{c1::detrás de}} la puerta.
Translation: The dog sleeps behind the door.

Text: La mochila está {{c1::delante de}} la silla.
Translation: The backpack is in front of the chair.
Explanation: 'Delante de' indicates something in front of.

Translation: I come from Madrid.
It is hot during the summer.
Explanation: 'Durante' indicates time span. No cloze used because it's obvious.

Translation: Walk toward the station.
I will be here until eight o'clock.
Explanation: 'Hasta' indicates limit in time or space.

Translation: The painting is above the fireplace.
He went after her without hesitation.
I didn't go out because I was tired.
He went out without an umbrella.
He came with his sister.
They argued about politics.
I studied for three hours.

Text: Te cambio mi sándwich {{c1::por}} tu ensalada.
Translation: I'll trade you my sandwich for your salad.
Thanks for the gift.

Text: Este libro fue escrito {{c1::por}} un famoso autor.
Translation: This book was written by a famous author.
Explanation: 'Por' identifies the agent in passive constructions.

Text: Salimos {{c1::para}} la playa a las ocho.
Translation: We’re leaving for the beach at eight.
This report is for tomorrow.
I study to learn Spanish.
This gift is for you.
I work for an international company.
I ran through the park this morning.
